page.title: 12CAERWYS WALK cont.
page.content: The hedgerows were mainly of hawthorn and hazel with many deciduous trees like oak and sycamore.In the hedges we found these wild flowers:-{ {Sheperd's Purse,Wild Strawberry,Sanide {Jack-by-the hedge,Crosswort,Common {Speedwell,Mouse Ear,Chickweed,Violet, {Red Campion,Cow Parsley,Ladies {Slipper,Water Avens,Periwinkle,Cow {Chevil,Wild Rose and Herb Robert.} We continued over a crossroads and turned left along a footpath back towards Caerwys.We took care not to frighten some milking cows and then entered the town behind St.Micheal's Estate and returned to school via Holywell Road,Drovers Lane and Pen-y-Cefn Road. The walk was between 2 and 3 miles long and took us nearly two hours.
